Title: We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data Team!
Description:
Telenor Connexion is a leading, Scandinavian provider of IoT (Internet of Things) services with over 20 years of experience working with enterprises around the world.




We are a global leader in connecting things and manage more than 20 million connections across the world for multinational customers such as Volvo, Scania, Hitachi, Verisure Securitas Direct and Husqvarna. We provide easy and reliable access to every market in the world and enable industry leading players to connect their products and services on a global scale across every vertical.




Telenor Connexion is a specialized IoT company within the Telenor Group and together we rank among the top IoT operators in Europe and in the world. With headquarters and tech center located in the Nordics, we have sales representation in the UK, US, Germany, South Africa, South Korea, China, Australia, Malaysia & Japan.




The role

We are looking for an influential, highly agile, and collaborative Data Analyst to join our high performing team!




Telenor IoT has a real-time big data solution in production since 2015. The solution is continuously evolving, and we are currently on our 3rd generation architecture. We process more than 400 000 000 real-time events per year and similar amounts of records are batch processed. Currently we run 3600 ML-models in production. Everything is available in our data platform, and this is a gold mine of high-quality data that our Data Science & Analytics team utilize to serve business and customers with insights.




The solution covers many advanced data products, ranging from real-time AI-based anomaly detection, data driven risk analyses, visual analytics applications, timely reports with directly actionable tasks, individualized notifications on account level in Salesforce and a customer-facing Analytics Application.




As a Data Analyst in Telenor Connexion, you are backed up with an insight hungry and data savvy organizational culture, a strong data engineering team, mindboggling amounts of data, and all the tools and services you need in your role to deliver meaningful difference to the business and customers. We are counting on you in advising, mentoring, and training relevant colleagues to democratize data services across the organization. You will actively collaborate with other data centric teams like Business Control, Billing Operations, Pricing Management, Roaming Management and Service Operations Center.




You will have three main responsibilities:

Develop and maintain Visual Analytics applications in Amazon Quicksight
Develop and maintain file-based recurring reports in our report-service.
Monitor and manage our Ad-hoc analytics inbox and deliver Ad-hoc analytics insights to the requestor.




This role reports to our Head of Data and you can be located in Karlskrona, Göteborg or Stockholm. A majority of the team is in Stockholm.




Tasks and responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at Telenor Connexion, your key responsibility is to deliver data driven insights to the business and customers.




You will:

Deploy Reports and Analytics apps into production.
Deliver Analytics prototypes and Proof of Concepts
Act as superuser and advisor to business using Analytics apps, query-development and reports, ensure documentation is available at appropriate level.
Manage and evolve the Data-as-a-Product CI/CD pipeline.
Continuously improve Ad-hoc Analytics workflow.
Stay UpToDate and be an expert on the data in our data platform.
Support Data Engineers with validation of data quality and correctness in UAT and production in relation to the release process of the data platform.
Continuously analyze data quality in data platforms and follow up on suggested improvements with data engineers and platform architect.
Feed business- and analytics-based requirements into the backlog and road map of our data platforms.
Lead the data investigation in Root-cause-analysis in case of disturbances and incidents.
Translate complicated and vague business problems into a well-defined Data and Insights solutions.
Mentoring and train relevant colleagues to democratize data services across the organization




Experience and skills

In order to succeed in this role, you will need:

MS/MSc degree in engineering or relevant domain
Strong quantative skills and the ability to translate data into strategic insights
Strong SQL skills for analytical reporting
Strong skills in data visualization and storytelling
Good knowledge of Python and DBT




Meritorious:

Familiar with AWS technologies
Experience of working with AWS QuickSight
Experience of working with Trino (Pandas/PySpark is a plus)
Knowledgeable in IoT and/or Mobile network/connectivity technologies.




Other requirements:

Swedish residency and work permit
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish.




As a person:

We are looking for a committed person with a positive attitude and strong self-leadership. You are a naturally influential person and an excellent communicator with good stakeholder management skills. You are highly efficient and have a good ability to conceptualize complex technical problems. We also believe you need good skills in time management and great attention to details. Our team is highly agile and collaborative, we hope that this resonates with you too.

This role might be right for you even if you are at the beginning of your career, if you have a relevant education, the right personality and ability to quickly develop and grow into this role.




Our Offer

Telenor Connexion offers you a chance to be a part of one of the most interesting areas within the tech industry where the work we do has a huge impact on almost all areas in society. We are a fast-growing international company with great possibilities for your career ahead. Telenor Connexion is a flat and people-oriented organization with attractive job benefits where you have the opportunity to influence and build your role and make a real difference in building our brand.




We are a company where people stay long, where you are able to transition into new career-tracks or grow and evolve in your existing role. Overall, we have an inclusive and highly engaging company culture – known for its eager to change towards and an ever-changing market, but also our innovation capacity and thought-leadership. What unites us all is a dedication to providing our customers with solutions and services that have a positive effect on businesses and society.




You will also have:

Attractive and competitive bonus scheme
Additional days off during the year
Flexible and hybrid work policy
Nice offices for collaborative work
Training and development focused company
Friendly work environment that recognizes each employee’s potential and value
Talented and engaged colleagues all around the world.




Placement: Stockholm, Göteborg or Karlskrona




Application and contact: Please apply through our recruitment system Workday.




For questions, do not hesitate to contact Anders Bresell, Head of Data Science & Analytics, anders.bresell@telenorconnexion.com




Deadline: The closing date for applications is November 24th, at the latest. If you are interested, please apply as soon as possible as we will interview continuously. The position might be filled before the closing date.

Everything is available in our data platform, and this is a gold mine of high-quality data that our Data Science & Analytics team utilize to serve business and customers with insights.


The solution covers many advanced data products, ranging from real-time AI-based anomaly detection, data driven risk analyses, visual analytics applications, timely reports with directly actionable tasks, individualized notifications on account level in Salesforce and a customer-facing Analytics Application.


As a Data Analyst in Telenor Connexion, you are backed up with an insight hungry and data savvy organizational culture, a strong data engineering team, mindboggling amounts of data, and all the tools and services you need in your role to deliver meaningful difference to the business and customers. We are counting on you in advising, mentoring, and training relevant colleagues to democratize data services across the organization. You will actively collaborate with other data centric teams like Business Control, Billing Operations, Pricing Management, Roaming Management and Service Operations Center.


You will have three main responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain Visual Analytics applications in Amazon Quicksight
  • Develop and maintain file-based recurring reports in our report-service.
  • Monitor and manage our Ad-hoc analytics inbox and deliver Ad-hoc analytics insights to the requestor.


This role reports to our Head of Data and you can be located in Karlskrona, Göteborg or Stockholm. A majority of the team is in Stockholm.


Tasks and responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at Telenor Connexion, your key responsibility is to deliver data driven insights to the business and customers.


You will:

  • Deploy Reports and Analytics apps into production.
  • Deliver Analytics prototypes and Proof of Concepts
  • Act as superuser and advisor to business using Analytics apps, query-development and reports, ensure documentation is available at appropriate level.
  • Manage and evolve the Data-as-a-Product CI/CD pipeline.
  • Continuously improve Ad-hoc Analytics workflow.
  • Stay UpToDate and be an expert on the data in our data platform.
  • Support Data Engineers with validation of data quality and correctness in UAT and production in relation to the release process of the data platform.
  • Continuously analyze data quality in data platforms and follow up on suggested improvements with data engineers and platform architect.
  • Feed business- and analytics-based requirements into the backlog and road map of our data platforms.
  • Lead the data investigation in Root-cause-analysis in case of disturbances and incidents.
  • Translate complicated and vague business problems into a well-defined Data and Insights solutions.
  • Mentoring and train relevant colleagues to democratize data services across the organization


Experience and skills

In order to succeed in this role, you will need:

  • MS/MSc degree in engineering or relevant domain
  • Strong quantative skills and the ability to translate data into strategic insights
  • Strong SQL skills for analytical reporting
  • Strong skills in data visualization and storytelling
  • Good knowledge of Python and DBT


Meritorious:

  • Familiar with AWS technologies
  • Experience of working with AWS QuickSight
  • Experience of working with Trino (Pandas/PySpark is a plus)
  • Knowledgeable in IoT and/or Mobile network/connectivity technologies.


Other requirements:

  • Swedish residency and work permit
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish.


As a person:

We are looking for a committed person with a positive attitude and strong self-leadership. You are a naturally influential person and an excellent communicator with good stakeholder management skills. You are highly efficient and have a good ability to conceptualize complex technical problems. We also believe you need good skills in time management and great attention to details. Our team is highly agile and collaborative, we hope that this resonates with you too.

This role might be right for you even if you are at the beginning of your career, if you have a relevant education, the right personality and ability to quickly develop and grow into this role.


Our Offer

Telenor Connexion offers you a chance to be a part of one of the most interesting areas within the tech industry where the work we do has a huge impact on almost all areas in society. We are a fast-growing international company with great possibilities for your career ahead. Telenor Connexion is a flat and people-oriented organization with attractive job benefits where you have the opportunity to influence and build your role and make a real difference in building our brand.


We are a company where people stay long, where you are able to transition into new career-tracks or grow and evolve in your existing role. Overall, we have an inclusive and highly engaging company culture – known for its eager to change towards and an ever-changing market, but also our innovation capacity and thought-leadership. What unites us all is a dedication to providing our customers with solutions and services that have a positive effect on businesses and society.


You will also have:

  • Attractive and competitive bonus scheme
  • Additional days off during the year
  • Flexible and hybrid work policy
  • Nice offices for collaborative work
  • Training and development focused company
  • Friendly work environment that recognizes each employee’s potential and value
  • Talented and engaged colleagues all around the world.


Placement: Stockholm, Göteborg or Karlskrona


Application and contact: Please apply through our recruitment system Workday.


For questions, do not hesitate to contact Anders Bresell, Head of Data Science & Analytics, anders.bresell@telenorconnexion.com


Deadline: The closing date for applications is November 24th, at the latest. If you are interested, please apply as soon as possible as we will interview continuously. The position might be filled before the closing date.

Title: ESG & Impact Data Analyst
Description:
Looking to drive and challenge your exceptional talent in data and reporting to the next level?

Motivated to be part of a group dedicated to enabling sustainable solutions in under-developed regions?

Swedfund is looking for a ESG & Data Analyst who will collaborate across multiple teams to ensure both data collection, quality and integrity in their growing portfolio of investments.

Key role associated tasks


Ensure accurate gathering and registration of key environmental and social data related to investments
Drive and take ownership of various key data collection tasks like the annual sustainability data
Closely collaborate with the Investment teams in analysing and evaluating key financial and non-financial data
Transform investment data into key impact, ESG and financial performance indicators demonstrating results of Swedfund’s investment portfolio
Work daily with key sustainability calculation models
Participate in and drive various internal data related projects across Swedfund’s entire organisation


Skills And Experience

Aside from relevant academic qualifications, relevant candidates will possess more than 3 years’ experience of working with data management in both a financial and non-financial context. Your analytical skills are complimented by advanced excel levels, with exposure to power query, VBA and macros. Previous work and knowledge of climate emission standards like PCAF will be considered highly advantageous. Professional proficiency in English is required.

More About Swedfund

Swedfund International AB is the Swedish government’s development finance institution, a state-owned company with a societal mission managed by the Ministry of Finance and financed through portfolio reflows and annual capital injections for which the Swedish Ministry for Foreign Affairs is responsible.

Read more about Swedfund

Questions and contact

Swedfund is working with Amendo in this recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this specific role, please contact Talent Recruitment Manager Shaun Ogden, shaun.ogden@amendo.se. Interviews and selection are ongoing so please do not hesitate to register your interest in the role immediately.

Final candidates will be required to approve a background screening review.

#analyst

Amendo är en av Sveriges ledande aktörer inom rekrytering och konsultuthyrning med en tydlig inriktning mot ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation. Vi är ett expansivt bolag verksamma över hela Sverige med lokala kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Sundsvall och Luleå. Vår vision att utveckla världen med kompetens når vi genom att arbeta nära våra kunder och kandidater, vara nyfikna på omvärlden - och hela tiden vilja framåt.

Amendo är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001.

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Walker Labs are a venture-backed video game and next-gen web technology developer. Our strategy is to combine AAA experienced veterans from DICE, Epic Games, Microsoft, Mojang, Ubisoft, Remedy, Sony and EA – with best in class Web Tech developers, to create never-seen-before experiences in gaming and digital social spaces.

As a Data Analyst at Walker Labs, you will be a key player in understanding how players interact with our products. You will work together with people from many different areas to make our game perform better when it comes to engagement, monetization as well as pure gameplay experience. There is no former Analytics Department, you are it, which means you will have a lot of freedom but also responsibility when shaping the supporting processes and tools.

What you get to do:


Define key metrics for understanding player engagement and monetization
Together with the development team, define key metrics for pure gameplay experience
Participate in getting a suitable data pipeline including analysis and reporting tools up and running
Assess incoming data quality, working together with the team to improve it
Ensure key stakeholders within the team have easy access to the resulting information, and incorporate it in their decision making
Gradually improve our understanding of our players, by asking questions yourself, and driving change in our data pipeline accordingly


Worth noting is that service health is not part of this effort; the focus is on player experience.

What You Bring To The Role

Key here is a self-driven mindset; you will be the domain expert and as such you are best suited to identify how we should grow and improve in areas such as:


(Most important) Experience working with engagement metrics typical to video games; MAU/DAU/CCU, churn rate, etc.
(2nd most important) Experience working with monetization metrics typical to video games; ARPU/ARPPU etc.
(3rd most important) Experience working with gameplay metrics; popularity of different player choices, correlation between churn and player choices, etc.
A solid understanding of the mathematical/statistical foundations that underpin these metrics
Experience with different data pipelines, presentation tools & platforms
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English)


Bonus:


Experience democratizing the use of data in teams’ decision making processes


Our offer:

At Walker Labs, we put value in our team. We offer competitive salaries, encourage collaboration and entrust our employees with creative agency and ownership. We also pride ourselves in having a healthy work-life balance, and offer flexibility with family commitments and other personal matters where possible. We invite you to join our team to venture into the unknown to bring new and exciting experiences to gamers.

Walker Labs is committed to inclusion and diversity. We ensure we give equal opportunities to all of our employees and provide a safe workplace where everyone is valued and heard — without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics.

___

If this role isn’t the perfect fit for you, we’d still love to hear from you! Share how you believe you could add value to our team and projects, we welcome you to connect with us!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have an interest in the society and want to help public organisations in making data-driven decisions? This is your opportunity to be at the forefront of supporting leading public organisations on their path towards innovation.




What we do:

ADC is a Data & AI Consultancy driving the responsible adoption of data and AI to create real impact for organisations that matter. We support our clients achieve their goals through data-driven solutions with deep industry expertise. Our top talent is driven to leverage their advanced data and AI knowledge and experience for the good, working with, instead of for, our clients. We draw on our collective approach to empower pragmatic and comprehensive consultants, through inclusivity, trust, and ownership. Operating currently in Denmark, Sweden and the Netherlands, we aim to grow across Europe. Join us to be part of our growth journey.




In Sweden, as part of the Public & Society team, you will support clients in the public-, civil society-, and philanthropic sectors. You will contribute to the analysis in a range of economic and societal issues. You will be working with colleagues specialising in everything from AI and Econometrics to Sociology and Anthropology. Through analytics and strategy development we help our clients drive change, assess impact and spark innovation.




For this position, we are looking for candidates who are based in Sweden.




What you do:

1) Delivering Quantitative Projects:

You will be responsible for delivering high-quality quantitative analysis in an efficient manner.
This includes processing large datasets, conducting various forms of statistical and econometric analyses, and generating insights through data visualizations.
You will contribute to reports and presentations, translating complex findings into clear, actionable insights for a range of stakeholders.

2) Data Source Management and Development:

Continuously ensure the quality and relevance of the data sources used in your projects.
You will work closely with data suppliers to maintain access to relevant data, such as SCB registry data, company information databases, patent databases, and bibliometrics databases.
An essential part of the role is to assess and evaluate new and potential data sources, including both open (e.g., public sector information) and closed sources, to support the development of new offerings and solutions.

3) Methodology Development and Innovation:

You will contribute to the development of new methods that address client needs, working to enhance our analytical approaches.
This includes identifying and integrating emerging opportunities, particularly through AI technologies, to expand the capabilities of our analyses.




What you bring:

2 - 5 years of working experience in the field of Analytics, Statistics or Data Science (Consultancy experience is a big plus)
Experience and understanding of the Swedish Public Sector (e.g. policies, methodologies, research, innovation systems)
A quantitative MSc degree (e.g., Econometrics, Statistics, Data Science, quantitative social science, or similar)
Proficiency with relevant tools and programming languages (e.g., R, Python, Stata, or similar)
Strong hands-on experience with large datasets, e.g. bibliometrics, national statistics (micro data), company information, and patent data
Ability to translate complex technical analyses into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders
Excellent command of the English language (Swedish is a plus, Finnish is a plus)
Strong communication and presentation skills
A proactive, innovative mindset to explore data and AI technologies for helping decision makers understand complex phenomena
Strong ethical framework and a strong sense of responsibility, accountability, ownership and helping others




What we offer:

An open learning path where you will gain valuable experience through hands-on involvement and responsibility from day one
Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
An established client base among central governmental agencies and leading foundations in the Swedish Public Sector
Freedom to realize own initiatives and implement your ideas
A training programme focusing on your self-development, designed to transform people into trusted advisors, specialists, and ADC leaders
Possibility to get relevant certifications to become domain experts in the field
A knowledge sharing culture
Our Collective Week during which we work on pro bono projects and make unforgettable memories together with the entire company
A collective bonus
Possibility to invest in the company once fulfilling the conditions
A lot of social events




What to do next:

If you are inspired by the above, apply from the link below!

For questions, feel free to contact us from recruitment@adc-consulting.com




*Amsterdam Data Collective is an equal opportunity employer. To shape a better future, we value diversity and promote equality. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC . We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

💰Annual compensation review

🏆Recognition rewards

🏝 Annual holiday leave

👶Parental Leave

🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme

🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

💰Annual compensation review

🏆Recognition rewards

🏝 Annual holiday leave

👶Parental Leave

🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme

🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: IT Data Analyst - Snowflake 8 Months Contract
Description:
Belmont Lavan Ltd is seeking an IT Data Analyst - Snowflake with a focus on data warehousing and analytics. In this role, you will be responsible for leveraging the Snowflake platform to gather, analyze, and report on a variety of data sets to support business decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, build, and manage data pipelines to facilitate data ingestion and transformation in the Snowflake environment
Collaborate with stakeholders to define data requirements and specifications to ensure accurate reporting and analytics
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize key performance indicators and insights for various departments
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity across various datasets
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights
Work with cross-functional teams to implement solutions that enhance data collection and analysis
Provide support for ad-hoc data requests and analytical projects
Stay updated on best practices, tools, and methodologies related to Snowflake and data analysis



Skills Required:


Hands-on experience with Snowflake and data warehousing concepts
Proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and analysis
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders
Knowledge of ETL processes and data integration techniques
Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python or R for data analysis would be advantageous



Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
1-2 years of experience in a data analyst role or similar capacity
Certification in Snowflake or relevant data analytics tools would be advantageous



Requirements

Essential Skills:


Snowflake
SQL
Data Visualization (Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
ETL Processes
Analytical Skills
Data Integrity
Data Reporting
Python or R (advantageous)



Qualifications:


Degree in a related field
1-2 Years of Experience
Show more

Title: Data Analyst for Ventures and New Business
Description:
About Us

Everyone working at Scania is united by a common purpose: Driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. We know that the transport industry must change, and it’s a change we want to lead. Scania’s continuous transformative work within circularity, electrification and autonomy shows commercial ideas, powerful insights and competencies that make real change happen.

Ventures and New Business at Scania have a key role in driving the shift and contributing to this vision. We develop and deliver new businesses, supporting Scania’s long-term growth and profitability ambitions. At Ventures and New Business, we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments that strengthen and support our acceleration, driving the shift. We want to engage and inspire our entire organisation to create results together with us, and collaboration and entrepreneurial spirit are part of our culture and what makes us successful.

We are today a team of approximate 45+ people and have five ventures. Our office space is very central at Drottninggatan in Stockholm.

Job Description

As a Venture Data Analyst you will play a crucial role in supporting the growth and success of new business ventures by providing actionable insights through data analysis. By collecting, analysing, and interpreting data you will help guide strategic decisions and optimise business performance.

Reporting to our Tech Domain Manager, you will be aligned with one of our ventures while also working closely with other colleagues within your domain to share expertise and best practices.

Key responsibilities

In the role of Data Analyst for a venture your key responsibilites will be:



Data Collection and Management: Gathering, cleaning, and maintaining data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability for analysis.
Data Analysis: Conducting thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business strategies and decision-making.
Reporting and Visualisation: Creating clear and compelling reports, dashboards, and visualisations to communicate analytical findings to stakeholders.
Performance Monitoring: Tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to monitor the health and progress of business ventures.
Market Research: Conducting market research and competitor analysis to provide context and support strategic planning.
Collaboration: Working closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, marketing, and finance, to align data insights with business objectives.
Recommendations: Providing actionable recommendations based on data analysis to help optimise operations, improve customer experience, and drive growth.



About You

We seek someone with strong experience within data analytics. It is important that you are a positive influence and a good collaborator as you will interact with a wide array of internal and external stakeholders. Good communication skills are also key since you will be interacting closely with business executives both across the company and externally. You are a goal-oriented doer and a team player that loves to see how our business is growing.

We also believe that you (requirements):



Have a master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or similar field.
Bring 3+ years of experience in the analytics field, experience within the logistic industry is a plus.
Possess a high degree of autonomy and can work independently on complex analyses.
Have a solid and broad analytical skills-set including the ability to use statistical methods.
Are proficient in using data extraction tools.
Have experience working with BI tools such as QlikSense or Tableau.
Thrive in in a fast-growing company.
Are fluent in English



What we offer:

We offer you the chance to be part of an organisation that is focused on reaching Scania’s targets and truly driving the shift to a sustainable transport system. Joining our team you will get to enjoy the flexibility and agility of a startup enviroment while benefiting from the stability and security of being employed by one of Sweden's largest companies. With the opportunities of the current transformative changes within the transport industry, we are on a very exciting journey. This is the right time to join us!

Information and application

Questions about the role? Contact linda.rosenqvist@scania.com

We are working with an ongoing selection; please apply as soon as possible if you are interested, but no later than 2024-11-12.

Kindly note that a background check might be conducted for this position.

Scania is one of Sweden's largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Our mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries. For more information visit Scania.com
Show more

Kindly note that a background check might be conducted for this position.

Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries. For more information visit Scania.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (PowerBI) till samhällsviktigt uppdrag hos Fora




Är du en Data Analyst som brinner för att skapa insikter som bidrar till ett tryggare arbetsliv? På Fora söker vi nu en skicklig Data Analyst med expertis inom Power BI för att stödja vår mission att guida företag och individer rätt i sina kollektivavtalade pensions- och försäkringslösningar. Just nu befinner vi oss i en spännande utvecklingsfas, där du får möjlighet att arbeta nära våra affärsenheter och omvandla data till värdefulla insikter som gör skillnad.




Hos Fora får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken, utvecklas i din roll och driva ditt område framåt. Vill du vara en del av en arbetsplats som präglas av omtanke om människor och strävar efter ett enklare och tryggare arbetsliv? Då kan Fora vara rätt plats för dig.




Om rollen:

I rollen som Data Analyst kommer du att arbeta nära våra affärsenheter för att förstå deras behov och leverera insikter genom datavisualiseringar med hjälp av Power BI och andra verktyg. Du kommer att utveckla och underhålla interaktiva rapporter och dashboards, samt samarbeta med intressenter för att maximera den datadrivna kulturen inom organisationen.




Vem du är:

Vi söker dig som har en nyfikenhet och en passion för datadriven analys. Du är en kommunikativ lagspelare med förmåga att översätta tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska termer. Du trivs i en dynamisk miljö och är alltid redo att hjälpa andra att bli mer datadrivna.




För att lyckas i denna roll krävs följande kompetenser och erfarenheter:

Minst 3 års erfarenhet av dataanalys och rapportering med inriktning på Power BI.
Djup kunskap om Power BI, inklusive rapport- och dashboarddesign.
Erfarenhet av DAX för att skapa avancerade beräkningar.
Erfarenhet av att skriva SQL-frågor mot databaser.
Kunskap om Azure Synapse.
Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.




Meriterande erfarenheter:

Erfarenhet av att hålla utbildningar och workshops.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med andra BI-verktyg.




Om Fora:

Fora är ett serviceföretag som guidar 235 000 företag och cirka 4 miljoner individer rätt i sin kollektivavtalade pensions- och försäkringslösning. Genom smarta och prisvärda tjänster bidrar vi till ett tryggare arbetsliv och ett hållbart samhälle. Vi som arbetar på Fora gör skillnad för våra kunder när vi omsätter kunskap till kundnytta och skapar trygghet inom arbetslivet för många idag och imorgon. På Fora får vi energi och glädje av att jobba tillsammans för att hjälpa våra kunder. Vi arbetar i moderna, aktivitetsbaserade lokaler mitt i Stockholm och självklart omfattas alla av kollektivavtal.




Ansökan:

I denna rekrytering samarbetar Fora med HCM Partner AB. Vid frågor, kontakta Stina Lönnroth på stina@hcmpartner.se / 073 862 96 49. Urvalsprocessen och intervjuerna påbörjas omgående. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Consultant (Independent Consultant – Sweden-based)
Description:
We are looking for talented Data Analysts to join our network of consultants. You will leverage data to uncover insights, helping clients make informed decisions.

At Agile Search, we focus on tech recruitment and IT consultancy, helping connect skilled professionals with exciting projects. Our team works closely with both clients and consultants, creating personalized solutions for projects across Sweden. With a strong network and flexible approach, we collaborate with well-known companies, offering consultants the chance to work on rewarding and challenging assignments. We are committed to innovation and professional growth, ensuring success for everyone we work with.

Note: You must be based in Sweden and operate as an independent consultant.

Qualifications Needed:


4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with large datasets
Strong skills in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and SQL
Experience with statistical analysis and Excel; knowledge of Python/R is a plus
Familiarity with data modeling, business intelligence, and KPI reporting



Your role:


Analyze complex datasets to extract actionable business insights
Create compelling dashboards and reports to present findings to stakeholders
Work closely with clients to understand their data requirements
Identify data trends, patterns, and opportunities for business optimization
Maintain and refine data collection processes to improve accuracy

Title: Data Analyst (11 months Parental Leave)
Description:
Company Description

**Please note this is a parental leave for 11 months**

H&M Group is one of the biggest fashion companies in the world. We are a family of brands, driven by our mission to make a sustainable lifestyle an option for the many. With our customers at heart, we offer fashion, design, and services to millions of customers every day. 

We believe that it’s when you mix and match different talents, experiences, and styles that the real magic happens. That’s why our teams are built with different personalities, talents and people from all kinds of backgrounds. If you are willing to learn, grow and help our customers and your colleagues, H&M will always be a place for you to both express your individuality and feel like you belong. 

Be yourself & more at H&M. 

Job Description

As a  Data Analyst in the value stream External Products and Partners, you will work closely with Project leaders, Controllers, Business Units and Product teams to create value from data while working towards the goal of improving data foundation and make it possible to evaluate and track the External Brand Business performance and future potentials for the H&M group. 

You will make sure to enable the right attributes and KPIs in the system to secure and develop analysis for external brands as well as finding the potential in data together with other stakeholders for further developments. 

You will work with multiple complex data sources, prepare data, aggregate, and transform both structured & unstructured data. You will create analysis, build reporting tools and dashboards, and products around data, while securing the realization of business value from data. 

This is a highly technical, analytical, and business oriented role that secures analysis and reporting for External Brands. Your focus will be transforming and visualizing large amount of data for many users in a complex data environment. You will be cooperating with large amounts of stakeholders coming from different backgrounds both internally and externally, why we need you to be able to project lead and take own initiatives. 

You will work in a dynamic and diverse team where you will be the main responsible for data and reports for the External Brand business. In this role you will be able to drive change, have the possibility to influence and develop and structure the data possibilities for the external brand business. To succeed you will also need to be able to communicate clearly with many different stakeholders, be curious to solve technical problems and strive to truly understand our business. 

Tasks includes but are not limited to:


Define needs of and set-up measurable KPI’s on different levels of granularity and maintain their visualization by creating and maintaining intuitive dashboards  
Data prep: get the data from multiple complex data sources (APIs, databases, etc.) , clean and transform the data, develop data flows  
Be responsible for data availability and data quality of the value stream (ex: identifying missing data, troubleshooting with responsible data team, ...)
Combine, explore, and draw valuable insights from data. Work with large and complex data assets from different parts of the business  
Identify and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets to enable the business to take data-driven decisions  
Be responsible for external brand data integration with the existing business and business way of working 



Qualifications


3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst or similar relevant experience 
Academic degree within Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or similar  
Ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various stakeholders  
Ability to advise the business in the best solution from both a business and technical perspective  
Experience working within ecommerce, preferably in a multi-channel retail setting 
Ability to work with large and complex data sets. SQL skills is required (SSMS and BigQuery are preferred)
Experience in data visualization (Power BI) 
Experience in data modelling and DAX 
Experience using numerical, statistical, and analytical methods to apply to  data processing  
Ability to translate business requirements into analytical requirements  
Ability to align assignments with the strategic goals of the business    
Ability to establish priorities with clear goals and responsibilities to achieve a high level of performance 



Additional Information

H&M Group is a value-driven company that is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits and a flexible work life, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want.

The role is based in Stockholm. If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV in English. We will review and interview applicants continuously.

Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.

We look forward to receiving your application!

H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.
Show more

  • Ability to advise the business in the best solution from both a business and technical perspective  
  • Experience working within ecommerce, preferably in a multi-channel retail setting 
  • Ability to work with large and complex data sets. SQL skills is required (SSMS and BigQuery are preferred)
  • Experience in data visualization (Power BI) 
  • Experience in data modelling and DAX 
  • Experience using numerical, statistical, and analytical methods to apply to  data processing  
  • Ability to translate business requirements into analytical requirements  
  • Ability to align assignments with the strategic goals of the business    
  • Ability to establish priorities with clear goals and responsibilities to achieve a high level of performance 


Additional Information

H&M Group is a value-driven company that is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits and a flexible work life, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want.

The role is based in Stockholm. If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV in English. We will review and interview applicants continuously.

Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.

We look forward to receiving your application!

H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.




About the Data & Insight team

The Data & Insights team’s mission is to transform Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.

About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst at Trustly, you will look at the breadth of our data with a statistical mindset. Through your analytics skills and proficiency in handling data, you will uncover patterns and provide data-driven answers to complex strategic challenges. Depending on the stakeholder’s requests, you will choose adequate solutions to present your insights, ranging from dashboards in our BI tool to deep-dive analysis. In close collaboration with our data foundation team, you will be involved in building a strong and reliable data foundation that will support the analytics needs.




What you’ll do
Taking ownership of entire analytical projects, from defining objectives with our business stakeholders to delivering actionable insights and recommendations
Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and efficiency
Choose adequate analytical methods and tools to convey complex findings in a clear and concise manner
Continuously contribute to improve our Analytics capabilities 
Actively participate in establishing the data-driven culture at Trustly





Who you are
A Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or similar field
At least 3 years of experience within the analytics field, experience with the payments industry is a plus
Having a high degree of autonomy and being able to work independently on complex analyses
Solid and broad analytical skills-set including the ability to use statistical methods
Solid SQL and/or Python skills
Experience working with BI tools such as QlikSense or Tableau
Excellent communication skills 
Thrive in in a fast growing company








Kindly submit your CV in English.

Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.

If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now. 

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Bluestep Bank

At Bluestep Bank, we are passionate about enabling more people to get a mortgage. Our vision is to increase financial inclusion in society in a responsible way; by embracing our customers’ differences and focusing on their future potential.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced and strategic Senior Data Analyst to join our Data and Analytics team at Bluestep Bank. Your work will be vital in shaping our strategies and contributing to our company's success. This is a significant opportunity to make a real impact and help guide Bluestep Bank towards its long-term goals through your expertise in data analysis and strategic decision-making.

This role focuses on working with predictive models, especially in pricing and scorecards. You'll be responsible for analyzing and managing business data to create value and support the company's long-term goals. The role involves ensuring that data insights are aligned with our business objectives, making a significant contribution to advancing strategic initiatives.

In this role, you'll have the chance to make a real impact by providing insights that influence important decisions and improve performance. Your work will be key in supporting our digital transformation and moving the company forward.

About You

You have an academic degree in a technical or quantitative field and bring extensive experience in developing and implementing predictive models, particularly within pricing and scorecards. Experience in the banking or finance sector is a must, with a deep understanding of credit and mortgages being highly valued.

You can demonstrate a proven ability to drive results and advance the organization by producing actionable insights and recommendations within tight deadlines, balancing quick assessments with thorough analyses.

Functional Skills


over 15 years of hands-on work with predictive models, especially in pricing and scorecards, within the banking or finance sector.
ability to excel in fast-paced and dynamic environments
a natural ability to break down complex problems and collaborate across teams to find effective solutions
skilled at building strong relationships and communicating effectively with stakeholders at all organizational levels
you are fluent in both written and spoken English


Technical Skills


strong proficiency in SQL
solid knowledge of Excel
strong understanding of dimensional data models (starschema)


We are really in impressed if you also have experience with/in:


modern analysis and visualization tools, preferably Power BI
R, Python, SAS
machine learning techniques and algorithms


We offer

Along with a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive insurance and benefits package that includes health insurance, occupational pension, extra vacation days, parental leave pay, wellness benefits, lunch benefit, possibility for a bike benefit, and the flexibility of a hybrid workplace model, among others.

As part of our company, you will be part of an open-minded and inclusive culture, characterized by engagement and innovation where we dare to challenge and change. We believe in the values of co-operation and different perspectives. For the right person, we provide great opportunities for an exciting career.

Join our team and enjoy not only a rewarding career but also the perks of being part of a supportive and inclusive workplace. Welcome as you are.

Sounds interesting?

We would be happy to see your application as soon as possible as the selection is ongoing. Please note that a valid work permit for Sweden is required for this position.

In this recruitment, BlueStep Bank collaborates with HCM partners. For questions and concerns, please contact Stina Lönnroth at Stina@hcmpartner.se or 073 862 96 49 or Sara Burman at sara@hcmpartner.se 070 824 91 50.

Embracing inclusivity, we value each candidate based on their skills and experience. There is no need to include a photo in your application.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Map Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!







Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Swedish.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Sweden.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Sweden for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Data Engineer - AWS, Redshift, Python & SQL
Description:
About Sinch

Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.

Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.

At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!

Description


Develop and maintain scalable, resilient data pipelines using AWS services such as Lambda, Step Functions, Redshift, and S3.
Improve and maintain the Redshift data warehouse solution.
Manage the data lifecycle from ingestion and processing to storage and retrieval.
Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, with a primary focus on Python and SQL.
Actively contribute to enhancing our data processes and pipelines.
Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
Engage closely with data scientists, software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional data solutions.
Build and maintain visualizations and dashboards in Tableau.


Requirements


Capable of developing, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
Experienced professional in team-based software development and deployment.
Skilled in using SQL for data querying and ETL/ELT development.
Experienced in data warehousing (Redshift) and data modelling.
In-depth knowledge of AWS services including Lambda, Step Functions, Redshift, and S3.
Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
A passion for writing clean and efficient code.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, data engineering, or related technical discipline.


Good to have


Knowledgeable about various data architectures such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric.
Experience in data visualization tools.
Knowledge in or willing to learn infrastructure as code using Terraform.
Experience in a similar industry or related one.
Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
Experience guiding and mentoring fellow engineers, empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


Embrace the challenge and join us!

Our Hiring Process

We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.

We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re passionate about helping our customers succeed and shaping the future of retail, fostering a collaborative and open environment where everyone’s voice is valued. As a Data Engineer, you’ll play a key role in developing and scaling our data platform. You’ll focus on building secure and efficient data pipelines, collaborating with analysts, product teams, and stakeholders to ensure our data infrastructure meets the evolving needs of our growing business.




Must Have:

Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
3+ years of experience in data engineering
Proven experience building data pipelines and processing large data sets
Experience with cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure)
Knowledge of Data Warehouse Automation and ETL tools (e.g., Dataform, DBT, Airflow, Matillion)
Strong understanding of building high-quality solutions for analysts
Passion for data processing applications
Agile mindset and strong collaboration skills
Interest in building and maintaining CI/CD systems




Nice to Have:

Knowledge of Git, Docker, Terraform, and Python
Experience with transformation tools (Dataform or DBT)
Familiarity with client logging
Experience working with streaming data

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineering that makes a difference

At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. Now we are looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.

What You'll Do

You will be a part of the Commercial Data Hub and drive the Commercial data transformation journey towards a data culture where each product team expose their own data in an easily consumable way. To achieve this, we work in a multi-functional setting and your main responsibilities would include:


Building functionality that makes it easier for data consumers within Commercial to consume data in Snowflake
Building and maintaining source and business aligned data products
Giving professional data engineering support to data consumers and help them using the data according to best practices


What You'll Bring

The ideal candidate will possess not only extensive experience with the data engineering technologies we use, but also a high level of proficiency in soft skills.

Your main technical responsibilities includes implementing tooling, developing data pipelines and data governance solutions. Snowflake is used to expose data for analytical purposes and the role requires a solid understanding of Snowflake, including access handling and data protection. Our tech stack is based on Azure, SQL, Python, Snowflake, Airflow and DBT and previous experience working with those technologies will be valuable in the role.

On the soft skills side, you should be a collaborative team player who is adaptable and open to changes. A keen interest in learning and delivering is essential, along with a receptiveness to different perspectives. The role involves significant interaction with stakeholders. You will support analysts and business functions to consume data in an effective way. Understanding their needs and how we can assist them is crucial. Collaboration with the central data platform team is also key, where you will suggest features that aid our team, product teams and data consumers.

The role is a full time position based in Stockholm. You are at this point in time expected to work from the office in average three days per week.

Sounds interesting?

We’d love to receive and review your application. If you want more information about the role and its responsibilities or simply learn a bit more about the team, please reach out to the hiring manager at milika.jovanovic@volvocars.com

Volvo Cars - Driving change together

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations so you can reach your full potential.

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, 50% of which will be electric vehicles and sold directly to customers through digital channels. Join us on the journey of a lifetime as we create the driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We now have a new need and are therefore looking for a consulting colleague with the qualifications below. The position is part of our consulting services, which means you will be employed by us and work with clients or internal projects and assignments.

Role:


Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies


Essential requirements:


GCP service – (bigquery, cloud run, cloud functions, pubsub, dataflow, cloud composer, etc.)
SQL
Python
DBT
Terraform
Basics of Azure (optional depending on which migration team needs)
Good to have informatica or other ETL background (optional depending on which migration team needs)


Required cloud certification: GCP professional

Last day to apply:08-11-2024

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.
Show more
HTML:
We now have a new need and are therefore looking for a consulting colleague with the qualifications below. The position is part of our consulting services, which means you will be employed by us and work with clients or internal projects and assignments.

Role:

  • Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
  • Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
  • Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
  • Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
  • Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
  • Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
  • Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies

Essential requirements:

  • GCP service – (bigquery, cloud run, cloud functions, pubsub, dataflow, cloud composer, etc.)
  • SQL
  • Python
  • DBT
  • Terraform
  • Basics of Azure (optional depending on which migration team needs)
  • Good to have informatica or other ETL background (optional depending on which migration team needs)

Required cloud certification: GCP professional

Title: People Analytics Manager(SQL)
Description:
Job Description

Together with our amazing People Analytics teammates from DoorDash, we’re looking for an Analytics Manager to lead our small but mighty team of analysts responsible for self-service reporting and deep dives across the People space. The ideal candidate will excel as a “player - coach”, excited to provide functional leadership to the team, provide thought partnership to their stakeholders, and roll up their sleeves to dive into the data themselves.

The role can be based in Finland (preferred), or Sweden. You can work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the mentioned locations - the work format is up to you 🙌

You will work directly with stakeholders across the Wolt people team (as well as the rest of the Wolt business), serving as their thought partner to solve problems and prioritize solutions to big, thorny questions. You will report directly to the US-based Sr. Manager of People Analytics at DoorDash, and will partner closely with them and your US-based peers in Recruiting Analytics and Data Science to lead People Analytics across the globe.

Your daily work will include


Supervising the day-to-day work of your team of analysts responsible for people analytics, recruiting analytics, and similar.
Serving as the trusted advisor, thought leader, and representative of the global People Analytics team to your stakeholders across Wolt.
Leading the development of metrics, reports, dashboards and analyses, putting high-quality insights directly into the hands of your stakeholders.
Developing a cohesive vision and roadmap together with your peers and partner teams across the globe, including US-based Data Science, People Analytics, Recruiting Analytics, Data Engineering, and People Applications teams.
Dive into the data, diagnosing data and reporting needs, building new solutions, and providing answers to big, ambiguous, critical problems.


Our humble expectations


Education: Degree in a quantitatively focused discipline, e.g., experimental psychology, economics, computer science, physics, or similar.
Strong experience working as an Analyst, BI Developer, Analytics Engineer, Data Scientist, or techy Data Analyst. People/HR Analytics experience is strongly preferred.
Experience leading small teams with outsized impact.
Demonstrated experience working with and influencing technical and nontechnical cross-functional peers and stakeholders. This will be a highly visible role within the People Team, and building trust with your colleagues will be critical.
Tech skills: Python, SQL, R, AWS, and one of the modern BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Sigma, or similar). Advanced SQL skills, and ability to write optimized queries for large data sets.
Subject Matter Expertise: Deep expertise in data visualization and analysis. Some expertise in statistics is preferred (regressions, t-tests). Nice to have: Experience analyzing survey data.
Since you’ll be taking care of our internal stakeholders, we’re looking for someone who truly enjoys interacting with people on a daily basis. The ability to search for information and ask relevant questions from various teams will be crucial.


Next Steps

Why you'll love working with us

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!


Complex environment with tons of data just waiting to be utilized — you’ll get hands-on experience in working on various TA metrics and topics.
You can choose the ways of working - work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the locations mentioned above.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, think big but stay humble, do right by people, treat others kindly and justly, and recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:

Orsi Kocsis, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - orsolya.kocsis@wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants, and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants), and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 31 countries today, 27 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

So, why work at Wolt?

At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.

You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself, and being around friendly, humble, and ambitious people.

We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.
Show more

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
