Title: Dataanalytiker/ ingenjör
Description:
Tycker du om att jobba med data? Om du dessutom älskar båtliv vill du inte missa detta jobb!

Skippo driver Nordens mest älskade navigationsapp som används av närmare en miljon båtmäniskor. Vårt mål är att radikalt förbättra och förenkla båtlivet för alla Nordens båtmänniskor och nu söker vi en Dataanalytiker/ ingenjör som vill vara med och bygga framtidens båttjänster.

I Norden är båtlivet ett unikt kulturarv med fler båtar per capita än någon annanstans i världen. Trots en generellt hög digitaliseringsgrad har båtvärlden förblivit traditionell och analog - det vill vi ändra på!

Skippo grundades 2022 genom förvärvet av kart- och navigationsappen 'På Sjön' från Eniro (läs allt om det här!). Vi har ambitiösa planer vad gäller user experience, nya funktioner och tjänster som kan bidra till ett bättre, enklare, säkrare och mer inspirerande båtliv!

Nu söker vi en extraordinär Dataanalytiker/ ingenjör till vårt team i Stockholm med förmåga att strukturera, bearbeta, analysera och presentera information som ett led i digitalisering av båtlivet i Norden.

I Skippos ecosystem kommer data från en mängd olika källor och inkluderar allt från prenumerationsdata, data om hur appen används, positionsdata till väder data och information inmatad av användare så som information om deras båt samt annan UGC. Som Dataanalytiker/ ingenjör kommer du att ha en central roll i att identifiera och korrelera datakällor, samt implementera och/eller konfigurera verktyg för analys och visualisering. Till din support har du ett team av engagerade, problemlösningsorienterade och kunniga kollegor - utvecklare, produktägare, UX/UI designers, CRM- och marknadsföringsexperter etc..

Arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden:


Ansvara för insamling, lagring och analys av data som behövs såväl operativt för att drifta våra tjänster samt internt för att fatta faktabaserade beslut i hela organisationen (inom ledningen, produktutveckling, marknadsföring, finans).
Proaktivt jobba med produktteamet och utvecklare för att identifiera och analysera data och information för att bättre förstå användarbeteenden och förbättringsmöjligheter.
Omsätta den enorma mängd användardata från våra nästan en miljon användare till att skapa slutprodukter och funktioner till användare (t.ex. vilken naturhamn som passar en användare bäst givet olika vindstyrkor/ vindriktningar, väder, båttyp/ storlek, säsong etc.)
Löpande övervaka och kvalitétssäkra datakällor.
Skapa och underhålla rapporter och dashboards.
Visualisera data för internt och externt bruk.


Kvalifikationer:

För att leverera i denna roll behöver du ha ett brinnande intresse för dataanalys. Dessutom tickar du av nästan alla av följande kompetenser/egenskaper:


Relevant utbildning och erfarenhet av att arbeta med datainsamling och analys.
Erfarenhet av AI/ML eller liknande.
Stark analytisk skärpa med förmåga att tolka och identifiera mönster i användardata.
Förmåga att omsätta insikter till effektiva handlingsplaner.
Förmåga att identifiera mönster och avvikelser i data, testa hypoteser och dra slutsatser.
Strukturerad, noggrann och uppmärksam på detaljer.
Erfarenhet av att jobba med SQL-databaser och i synnerhet BigQuery.
Hands-on erfarenhet av visualiseringsverktyg och i synnerhet Looker Studio.
Vi jobbar också med AppsFlyer, RevenueCat, GoogleAnalytics, KafkaStreams och Braze - ju flera av dessa du känner desto bättre.
Idé- och initiativrik med förmåga att hålla många projekt i luften samtidigt.
Du kommunicerar felfritt på svenska och engelska.
Ett intresse för båtlivet och allra helst egen erfarenhet av båtlivet i Norden.


Vad du kan förvänta dig av Skippo:


En chans att bidra till att radikalt förändra en industri som släpar efter digitalt.
Möjligheten att få jobba med en spännande tjänst i ständig utveckling.
En samarbetsinriktad arbetskultur med högt i tak, där varje åsikt räknas.


Detta är vår första dedikerade data-relaterad roll vilket innebär ett stort ansvar men också en fantastisk möjlighet att påverka både organisationen och arbetssättet.

Tveka inte att höra av dig till nesa@skippo.io om du har några frågor eller funderingar. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
Show more

  • Stark analytisk skärpa med förmåga att tolka och identifiera mönster i användardata.

  • Strukturerad, noggrann och uppmärksam på detaljer.
  • Erfarenhet av att jobba med SQL-databaser och i synnerhet BigQuery.
  • Hands-on erfarenhet av visualiseringsverktyg och i synnerhet Looker Studio.
  • Vi jobbar också med AppsFlyer, RevenueCat, GoogleAnalytics, KafkaStreams och Braze - ju flera av dessa du känner desto bättre.
  • Idé- och initiativrik med förmåga att hålla många projekt i luften samtidigt.
  • Du kommunicerar felfritt på svenska och engelska.
  • Ett intresse för båtlivet och allra helst egen erfarenhet av båtlivet i Norden.

Vad du kan förvänta dig av Skippo:

  • En chans att bidra till att radikalt förändra en industri som släpar efter digitalt.
  • Möjligheten att få jobba med en spännande tjänst i ständig utveckling.
  • En samarbetsinriktad arbetskultur med högt i tak, där varje åsikt räknas.

Detta är vår första dedikerade data-relaterad roll vilket innebär ett stort ansvar men också en fantastisk möjlighet att påverka både organisationen och arbetssättet.

Tveka inte att höra av dig till nesa@skippo.io om du har några frågor eller funderingar. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Whitehall resources are looking for a Data Modeller. This role is based onsite in Sweden 2 days per week and remote working the remainder, for an initial 6 month contract.




Job Description:

Working experience in general data modelling like conceptual model, logical dimensional modelling

Adapt modelling methods from case studies or other proven approaches

Experience with data modelling for Redshift and Amazon

Experience of working in AWS cloud environment, Dbt

Experience in Implementation of physical models in databases

Knowledge of ingesting data into Amazon Redshift from on-prem data lake

Knowledge in AWS Data Pipeline, AWS Glue, AWS SCT etc

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Full job posting and application here: https://jobb.evidensia.se/jobs/5148099-data-engineer




Evidensia is undergoing an exciting digital transformation. Key to this is to improve the management of our core data sets and unlocking new insightful data points. This role plays a key role to accelerate our ability to collect and provide insights our IT systems and processes, allowing us to ultimately make better decisions as a company and for our patients.




About the position: 




As a data engineer, you play a key role in designing, developing and administering the data layer to support our organization to be ever more data driven. You are the main author of the data platform architecture, and work to align development with target architecture and ensure the architecture suits business requirements.  




Tasks and responsibilities include:

Design and implement target architecture for data platform
Ensure timely delivery of data by monitoring and troubleshooting issues with data quality or pipelines
Ensure data quality by implementing data validation checks and regular monitoring.
Optimize data platform performance, efficiency and security
Implement ETL processes to support an efficient BI platform in collaboration with BI analysts
Ownership of access and security processes in collaboration with IT Service Desk
Work as a project resource with requirement specifications and data integration development
Document and maintain documentation of data processes such as architecture, DLP, and security and compliance protocols
Monitor development of data engineering topics outside of the organization to ensure that we are moving towards a future-proof set-up




The position is full-time, located at our head office in Stockholm with the possibility of working partly from home. 




Who are we looking for? 

We are looking for a self-starter, that is decisive and able to work at pace. The candidate should be confident to prioritise, take ownership and make appropriate decisions to drive topics forward.




Moreover, the following following are key qualifications of the role:




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a related data infrastructure role.
Experience building and maintaining pipelines. This includes the use of REST APIs, JSON and ELT technologies/protocols for moving data between systems. Proficiency with Azure platform
Solid experience with programming languages such as Python
Hands-on experience with SQL databases
Experience with version control (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve data pipeline issues
Knowledge of data security and privacy best practices
Comfortable with being the face of IT – working directly with Finance, Marketing and other business units – for the systems and services in scope.
Capable of interfacing the IT Infrastructure team to ensure non-functional requirements, such as performance, scalability, resilience and identity/access management, are effectively delivered in the end-to-end solution.
Communicate fluently in English and a Scandinavian language.




Location: The role is located at Evidensia office in Stockholm, with the possibility of working partly from home.




Application deadline: We will review applications on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible for the best consideration.




If you have any questions about the position please contact

Head of Data & Analytics Northern Europe, Karl-Johan Sigurdson

karl-johan.sigurdson (at) evidensia.se, +46 70 085 84 85




We look forward to your application!

https://jobb.evidensia.se/jobs/5148099-data-engineer

Show more
HTML:
Full job posting and application here: https://jobb.evidensia.se/jobs/5148099-data-engineer


Evidensia is undergoing an exciting digital transformation. Key to this is to improve the management of our core data sets and unlocking new insightful data points. This role plays a key role to accelerate our ability to collect and provide insights our IT systems and processes, allowing us to ultimately make better decisions as a company and for our patients.


About the position: 


As a data engineer, you play a key role in designing, developing and administering the data layer to support our organization to be ever more data driven. You are the main author of the data platform architecture, and work to align development with target architecture and ensure the architecture suits business requirements.  


Tasks and responsibilities include:

  • Design and implement target architecture for data platform
  • Ensure timely delivery of data by monitoring and troubleshooting issues with data quality or pipelines
  • Ensure data quality by implementing data validation checks and regular monitoring.
  • Optimize data platform performance, efficiency and security
  • Implement ETL processes to support an efficient BI platform in collaboration with BI analysts
  • Ownership of access and security processes in collaboration with IT Service Desk
  • Work as a project resource with requirement specifications and data integration development
  • Document and maintain documentation of data processes such as architecture, DLP, and security and compliance protocols
  • Monitor development of data engineering topics outside of the organization to ensure that we are moving towards a future-proof set-up


The position is full-time, located at our head office in Stockholm with the possibility of working partly from home. 


Who are we looking for? 

We are looking for a self-starter, that is decisive and able to work at pace. The candidate should be confident to prioritise, take ownership and make appropriate decisions to drive topics forward.


Moreover, the following following are key qualifications of the role:


  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a related data infrastructure role.
  • Experience building and maintaining pipelines. This includes the use of REST APIs, JSON and ELT technologies/protocols for moving data between systems. Proficiency with Azure platform
  • Solid experience with programming languages such as Python
  • Hands-on experience with SQL databases
  • Experience with version control (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve data pipeline issues
  • Knowledge of data security and privacy best practices
  • Comfortable with being the face of IT – working directly with Finance, Marketing and other business units – for the systems and services in scope.
  • Capable of interfacing the IT Infrastructure team to ensure non-functional requirements, such as performance, scalability, resilience and identity/access management, are effectively delivered in the end-to-end solution.
  • Communicate fluently in English and a Scandinavian language.


Location: The role is located at Evidensia office in Stockholm, with the possibility of working partly from home.


Application deadline: We will review applications on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible for the best consideration.


If you have any questions about the position please contact

Head of Data & Analytics Northern Europe, Karl-Johan Sigurdson

karl-johan.sigurdson (at) evidensia.se, +46 70 085 84 85


We look forward to your application!

https://jobb.evidensia.se/jobs/5148099-data-engineer

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The role

You will be central in building out Soundtrack's data products, supporting an insights-led culture throughout the company and a personalised experience for our users. You will be a part of the Analytics Engineering team with the mission to collect raw data from backend systems and databases, user interaction events and other sources and transform it into well-defined, high-quality, accessible datasets and metrics, and expose them through self-service dashboards, APIs for our product and wherever Soundtrack can make valuable use of it.

You will be working tightly with our Analysts in defining the data needs of the company and fulfilling them. You will also regularly work with other development teams to coordinate how data is produced and transformed, and with consumers throughout all functions; Product Development, Growth, Marketing, Sales, Revenue, Finance and Legal.

Soundtrack’s technology stack is based on Google Cloud Platform. The team currently works mostly with SQL, BigQuery, Scala, Airflow, Google Dataflow, dbt, Tableau, Mixpanel and Terraform, together with other open-source and third-party services as needed, and you’ll be able to influence how we choose the right tool for the job going forward. You will be working a lot with defining, modelling, transforming, documenting and exposing data in a reliable, reusable and scalable way.

Responsibilities


Designing, defining, developing and maintaining critical datasets and metrics, and the pipelines that collect, transform and expose data for them
Working with data across all domains of Soundtrack; product, content, marketing, business and finance
Ensuring the reliability, accuracy, accessibility and cost-efficiency of both data and systems
Contributing to the team’s vision, strategy and agenda
Supporting the development of the team as a whole by sharing knowledge and helping each other grow


About You

You're friendly, professional, pragmatic, driven, precise and fun to work with. Also, you are probably comfortable describing yourself as:


A person with an agile mindset who feels comfortable with quickly adapting to constant change and who focuses on what is most important here and now
Curious and always eager to learn more
A good communicator that enjoy discussing different solutions and strategies for technical challenges
Having a passion for details - and a focus on getting things done!
A humble, open person who says what you mean and mean what you say


Mandatory requirements


Previous experience of building scalable, maintainable and robust data processing pipelines and management systems
Strong knowledge of SQL
Stable knowledge of general-purpose programming, preferably in a language generally used for data engineering, like Scala or Python
Knowledge of data modelling and processing tools like BigQuery, dbt, Apache Beam, Spark or similar
Experience building cloud native services


Beneficial Requirements (not Required)


Working with or close to quantitative analysis, KPIs or experimentation for product, content, financial or marketing performance
Automated testing, especially in the context of data transformation
Workflow orchestration tools like Airflow, Luigi, Dagster or similar
Experience or interest in functional programming
Developing reliable and performant backend API services, even better in the context of exposing large scale analytical data, Soundtrack uses GraphQL extensively
Continuous integration and deployment, Docker or Kubernetes
While this is a hybrid role, we do prefer candidates who live somewhat close to Stockholm for occasional team days at our office


About Us

Soundtrack Your Brand is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.

Employee benefits


You have the freedom to decide where you work the best with our Work From Anywhere program with a one-off setup bonus included
Generous pension plan
Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription.
Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
Daily breakfast served at the office


If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Fredrik Blomgren at fredrik.blomgren@soundtrackyourbrand.com.

If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Fredrik Blomgren at fredrik.blomgren@soundtrackyourbrand.com.

Title: Dataanalytiker till våra logistikkunder i Stockholm
Description:
Är du passionerad över att skapa smarta lagerlösningar och drivs av att analysera komplexa flöden på ett enkelt och pedagogiskt sätt? Pokayoke expanderar och vi söker nu en erfaren dataanalytiker/processutvecklare som vill vara med och ta vår och våra kunders verksamhet till nästa nivå. Om du har en tydlig bakgrund inom lagerlogistik och ett analytiskt sinnelag kan detta vara rollen för dig!

Om tjänsten

Som Dataanalytiker hos Pokayoke kommer du att:


Optimera lagernivåer och säkerställa att rätt material finns tillgängligt vid rätt tidpunkt.
Analysera materialflöden för att identifiera och eliminera flaskhalsar.
Utveckla strategier för att minska lagerkostnader utan att kompromissa med produktionens effektivitet.
Samarbeta med produktionsteamen hos våra kunder och externa leverantörer för att driva förbättringar inom logistik och hållbarhet.


Tjänsten innebär att du i din tjänst kommer att vara anställd hos Pokayoke och sedan vara uthyrd till våra kunder. Arbetet sker med andra ord delvis från vårt kontor i Stockholm och delvis ute hos våra kunder. Du rapporterar till vår Costumer Success Director.

Din bakgrund


Har erfarenhet inom supply chain management och lagerstyrning i en verksamhet som har en automationslösning och tillhörande WMS-system.
Är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och van att arbeta med dataanalys. Vill arbeta i en innovativ miljö där du får påverka och driva förändring.
Kan kommunicera på svenska och engelska obehindrat.
Erfarenhet att arbeta i ERP-system som tex Microsoft Dynamics/SAP.


Personliga egenskaper:

Vi söker dig som är strukturerad och analytisk med en naturlig förmåga att hitta lösningar på komplexa utmaningar. Du trivs med att arbeta självständigt och har erfarenhet av att driva projekt från start till mål. Rollen kräver en balans mellan analytisk expertis och praktisk erfarenhet inom dataanalys och/eller processutveckling, med fokus på att optimera lager och förbättra materialflöden för att säkerställa en effektiv och hållbar produktion.

Ansökan

Vi gör löpande urval och tillsätter tjänsten så fort vi har hittat "rätt" kandidat för jobbet. Alla frågor avseende tjänsten hänvisas till Erik Skotte, Head of Executive Search & Sales på esk@pokayoke.se eller 0766-23 23 52.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description:

As a Data Engineer at Dentsu Data (DD) is a data and analytics consulting company with approximately 20 employees that serves as a Center of Excellence and delivers services to customers throughout Dentsu. We are now looking for someone who is passionate about developing integrated data systems. The assignment is both about creating solutions for the dentsu group and advising customers on the best solution for them and then assisting in the implementation.




You will work together with the client teams across all dentsu agencies to support our clients' development in martech and data. The role involves a consultative role towards some of Sweden's largest companies and of course varies between different projects and customers. Our goal is to match consultants in the best way possible with assignments for development and innovation.




Technical Expertise: Serve as the technically knowledgeable person in customer teams. Advise on the best data solutions in an educational manner.
Implementation: Drive the implementation of data platforms. Develop solutions for data visualization.
Consultation: Work consultatively with some of Sweden’s largest companies. Support clients’ development in martech and data.
Collaboration: Collaborate with client teams across all Dentsu agencies. Match consultants with assignments for development and innovation.
Data Systems Development: Develop integrated data systems for the Dentsu group and its customers. Assist in the implementation of these systems.
Educational Role: Break down and present technical solutions to colleagues and customers based on their level of knowledge. Be the technically knowledgeable person in customer teams, who can take responsibility for and advise on the best solution in an educational way. Drive the implementation of data platforms and develop solutions for e.g. data visualization.




Who are you:

General understanding of marketing, tech and data, interest in predictive analytics.
Experience in programming in Python.
Accustomed to SQL.
Basic knowledge in the ETL (Extract Transform Load) process.
Habit of data visualization in dashboards (Power BI).
Data analysis/basic statistical competence.
Experience/knowledge in Cloud (Google Cloud Platform & BigQuery, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, or similar)
Very good language skills in both Swedish and English.
Experience with platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Salesforce, etc. is meritorious.




As a person, you are a self-motivated problem solver with a good ability to prioritize between tasks and projects. You are curious and have an interest in new technical solutions and opportunities to automate and streamline. You like to work in teams and have a pedagogical ability to break down and present technical solutions to both colleagues and customers based on their level of knowledge. To thrive in the role, we believe that you have a clear business mindset and are used to working consultatively.




ABOUT DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data, known for holistic customer insights and intelligent use of data that drives better business decisions. DD consists of two business areas. Our Business Intelligence team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). Our Audience Intellligence team works with our clients on issues related to budgeting, competitor monitoring, market research and effectiveness studies, and audience insights. DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.




DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings.




Additional Information:

Collective agreements
5000 SEK in wellness allowance
30 days holiday entitlement
Flexibility and the best possible mix of two good things, working in our offices and working from home
Great career and development opportunities




The position is full-time permanent employment with a 6-month probation period, located at our Stockholm office. Interviews are conducted continuously, and the start date is as soon as possible/according to the agreement. We look forward to receiving your application!




Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com

Title: Informationsarkitekt - Data & Analytics
Description:
Arbetsuppgifter


Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance


Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. På så sätt blir din drivkraft utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och för oss. Låter det bra? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Informationsarkitekt

Som Informationsarkitekt hos Data & Analytics kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att bygga och förädla den grund som vår data- och informationshantering vilar på. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi organiserar och strukturerar vår information, vilket är avgörande för vår förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut och skapa värde för våra kunder. Genom att utveckla avancerade begrepps-, informations- och datamodeller, samt leda workshops och analyser, kommer du att säkerställa att vi har en tydlig och effektiv informationsstruktur. Ditt arbete med att skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt ansvara för masterdata och relaterade processer kommer att vara centralt för vår Data & analytics-avdelning. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:


Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.


Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?


Analytisk
Helhetsperspektiv
Initiativtagande
Kommunikativ
Strukturerad


Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. På så sätt blir din drivkraft utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och för oss. Låter det bra? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Informationsarkitekt

Som Informationsarkitekt hos Data & Analytics kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att bygga och förädla den grund som vår data- och informationshantering vilar på. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi organiserar och strukturerar vår information, vilket är avgörande för vår förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut och skapa värde för våra kunder. Genom att utveckla avancerade begrepps-, informations- och datamodeller, samt leda workshops och analyser, kommer du att säkerställa att vi har en tydlig och effektiv informationsstruktur. Ditt arbete med att skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt ansvara för masterdata och relaterade processer kommer att vara centralt för vår Data & analytics-avdelning. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:

  • Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
  • Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
  • Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
  • Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
  • Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.

Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?

  • Analytisk
  • Helhetsperspektiv
  • Initiativtagande
  • Kommunikativ
  • Strukturerad

Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join the Treebula team and help shape the future of Sweden’s leading digital marketplace for forest owners. At Treebula, we use innovative digital solutions to maximize the potential of forests, empowering forest owners to manage their land, optimize timber sales, and explore new opportunities like biodiversity- and carbon credits.




As part of our team, you’ll play a crucial role in building our data infrastructure from the ground up. You will design and implement a new data warehouse, migrate existing data from sources like Google Sheets into structured storage, and ensure data accessibility through optimized queries. Your work will enable us to become more data-driven and to harness data insights that support our mission towards a sustainable and carbon-neutral future.




As a Data Engineer at Treebula:

You will collaborate closely with engineers and stakeholders to design and implement a scalable data warehouse. Your role will involve structuring data storage, developing efficient data pipelines, and ensuring that data is accurate and available for analysis. You will enable us to fetch data through custom SQL queries and empower our team with the tools needed for better decision-making.




Additionally, you will play a key role in tracking and processing data from our backend systems. This includes setting up data pipelines for API usage tracking, system logs, and other backend interactions, ensuring that critical data is captured and integrated into our data warehouse for real-time and historical analysis.




Responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain a new data warehouse to centralize and structure our data.
Extract data from existing sources like Google Sheets, transform it, and load it into the new database.
Set up and optimize data pipelines using AWS services to ensure seamless data flow.
Collaborate with software engineers to define and capture key system events, including API usage, system logs, and database changes.
Implement and maintain tools for monitoring and processing backend data streams, such as log analysis and event-driven architectures.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and integrate data into our Django and JavaScript-based platform.
Write efficient SQL queries to enable data retrieval and support analytics.
Develop tools and frameworks to facilitate data analysis and visualization.
Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations.
Support data-driven decision-making by providing clean, well-organized datasets.




What we’re looking for:

Proven experience in data engineering, with a focus on building and managing data warehouses.
Strong skills in SQL and Python for data manipulation, analysis, and database management.
Expertise in AWS services for data storage, processing, and architecture (e.g., S3, Redshift, RDS, Glue).
Experience with ETL tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Airflow, dbt).
Familiarity with Django and JavaScript environments for seamless data integration.
Experience with backend tracking, including setting up data pipelines for API usage, system logs, and real-time event processing.
Ability to translate business requirements into scalable data solutions.
Experience working in agile environments and a passion for innovation.




Bonus points:

Knowledge of forestry data or Geographic Information Systems (GIS).
Experience with Docker and containerization for data solutions.
Understanding of real-time data processing and streaming (e.g., Kafka).
Knowledge of machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, with an interest in integrating them into future data warehouse solutions.
Passion for sustainable technology and driving positive change in the forestry industry.




About Treebula

Treebula is Sweden’s leading digital marketplace for forest owners, offering innovative and smart solutions that unlock the full potential of forests. The forests are vital, providing renewable materials and absorbing carbon while playing a key role in combating climate change and fostering a sustainable society. We are committed to driving positive change in the forestry industry. With over 65,000 members, Treebula is more than a marketplace for timber and forestry products – we empower forest owners to make the most of their land.




Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (PowerBI) till samhällsviktigt uppdrag hos Fora




Är du en Data Analyst som brinner för att skapa insikter som bidrar till ett tryggare arbetsliv? På Fora söker vi nu en skicklig Data Analyst med expertis inom Power BI för att stödja vår mission att guida företag och individer rätt i sina kollektivavtalade pensions- och försäkringslösningar. Just nu befinner vi oss i en spännande utvecklingsfas, där du får möjlighet att arbeta nära våra affärsenheter och omvandla data till värdefulla insikter som gör skillnad.




Hos Fora får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken, utvecklas i din roll och driva ditt område framåt. Vill du vara en del av en arbetsplats som präglas av omtanke om människor och strävar efter ett enklare och tryggare arbetsliv? Då kan Fora vara rätt plats för dig.




Om rollen:

I rollen som Data Analyst kommer du att arbeta nära våra affärsenheter för att förstå deras behov och leverera insikter genom datavisualiseringar med hjälp av Power BI och andra verktyg. Du kommer att utveckla och underhålla interaktiva rapporter och dashboards, samt samarbeta med intressenter för att maximera den datadrivna kulturen inom organisationen.




Vem du är:

Vi söker dig som har en nyfikenhet och en passion för datadriven analys. Du är en kommunikativ lagspelare med förmåga att översätta tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska termer. Du trivs i en dynamisk miljö och är alltid redo att hjälpa andra att bli mer datadrivna.




För att lyckas i denna roll krävs följande kompetenser och erfarenheter:

Minst 3 års erfarenhet av dataanalys och rapportering med inriktning på Power BI.
Djup kunskap om Power BI, inklusive rapport- och dashboarddesign.
Erfarenhet av DAX för att skapa avancerade beräkningar.
Erfarenhet av att skriva SQL-frågor mot databaser.
Kunskap om Azure Synapse.
Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.




Meriterande erfarenheter:

Erfarenhet av att hålla utbildningar och workshops.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med andra BI-verktyg.




Om Fora:

Fora är ett serviceföretag som guidar 235 000 företag och cirka 4 miljoner individer rätt i sin kollektivavtalade pensions- och försäkringslösning. Genom smarta och prisvärda tjänster bidrar vi till ett tryggare arbetsliv och ett hållbart samhälle. Vi som arbetar på Fora gör skillnad för våra kunder när vi omsätter kunskap till kundnytta och skapar trygghet inom arbetslivet för många idag och imorgon. På Fora får vi energi och glädje av att jobba tillsammans för att hjälpa våra kunder. Vi arbetar i moderna, aktivitetsbaserade lokaler mitt i Stockholm och självklart omfattas alla av kollektivavtal.




Ansökan:

I denna rekrytering samarbetar Fora med HCM Partner AB. Vid frågor, kontakta Stina Lönnroth på stina@hcmpartner.se / 073 862 96 49. Urvalsprocessen och intervjuerna påbörjas omgående. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Consultant (Independent Consultant – Sweden-based)
Description:
We are looking for talented Data Analysts to join our network of consultants. You will leverage data to uncover insights, helping clients make informed decisions.

At Agile Search, we focus on tech recruitment and IT consultancy, helping connect skilled professionals with exciting projects. Our team works closely with both clients and consultants, creating personalized solutions for projects across Sweden. With a strong network and flexible approach, we collaborate with well-known companies, offering consultants the chance to work on rewarding and challenging assignments. We are committed to innovation and professional growth, ensuring success for everyone we work with.

Note: You must be based in Sweden and operate as an independent consultant.

Qualifications Needed:


4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with large datasets
Strong skills in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and SQL
Experience with statistical analysis and Excel; knowledge of Python/R is a plus
Familiarity with data modeling, business intelligence, and KPI reporting



Your role:


Analyze complex datasets to extract actionable business insights
Create compelling dashboards and reports to present findings to stakeholders
Work closely with clients to understand their data requirements
Identify data trends, patterns, and opportunities for business optimization
Maintain and refine data collection processes to improve accuracy

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re passionate about helping our customers succeed and shaping the future of retail, fostering a collaborative and open environment where everyone’s voice is valued. As a Data Engineer, you’ll play a key role in developing and scaling our data platform. You’ll focus on building secure and efficient data pipelines, collaborating with analysts, product teams, and stakeholders to ensure our data infrastructure meets the evolving needs of our growing business.




Must Have:

Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
3+ years of experience in data engineering
Proven experience building data pipelines and processing large data sets
Experience with cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure)
Knowledge of Data Warehouse Automation and ETL tools (e.g., Dataform, DBT, Airflow, Matillion)
Strong understanding of building high-quality solutions for analysts
Passion for data processing applications
Agile mindset and strong collaboration skills
Interest in building and maintaining CI/CD systems




Nice to Have:

Knowledge of Git, Docker, Terraform, and Python
Experience with transformation tools (Dataform or DBT)
Familiarity with client logging
Experience working with streaming data

Title: People Analytics Manager(SQL)
Description:
Job Description

Together with our amazing People Analytics teammates from DoorDash, we’re looking for an Analytics Manager to lead our small but mighty team of analysts responsible for self-service reporting and deep dives across the People space. The ideal candidate will excel as a “player - coach”, excited to provide functional leadership to the team, provide thought partnership to their stakeholders, and roll up their sleeves to dive into the data themselves.

The role can be based in Finland (preferred), or Sweden. You can work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the mentioned locations - the work format is up to you 🙌

You will work directly with stakeholders across the Wolt people team (as well as the rest of the Wolt business), serving as their thought partner to solve problems and prioritize solutions to big, thorny questions. You will report directly to the US-based Sr. Manager of People Analytics at DoorDash, and will partner closely with them and your US-based peers in Recruiting Analytics and Data Science to lead People Analytics across the globe.

Your daily work will include


Supervising the day-to-day work of your team of analysts responsible for people analytics, recruiting analytics, and similar.
Serving as the trusted advisor, thought leader, and representative of the global People Analytics team to your stakeholders across Wolt.
Leading the development of metrics, reports, dashboards and analyses, putting high-quality insights directly into the hands of your stakeholders.
Developing a cohesive vision and roadmap together with your peers and partner teams across the globe, including US-based Data Science, People Analytics, Recruiting Analytics, Data Engineering, and People Applications teams.
Dive into the data, diagnosing data and reporting needs, building new solutions, and providing answers to big, ambiguous, critical problems.


Our humble expectations


Education: Degree in a quantitatively focused discipline, e.g., experimental psychology, economics, computer science, physics, or similar.
Strong experience working as an Analyst, BI Developer, Analytics Engineer, Data Scientist, or techy Data Analyst. People/HR Analytics experience is strongly preferred.
Experience leading small teams with outsized impact.
Demonstrated experience working with and influencing technical and nontechnical cross-functional peers and stakeholders. This will be a highly visible role within the People Team, and building trust with your colleagues will be critical.
Tech skills: Python, SQL, R, AWS, and one of the modern BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Sigma, or similar). Advanced SQL skills, and ability to write optimized queries for large data sets.
Subject Matter Expertise: Deep expertise in data visualization and analysis. Some expertise in statistics is preferred (regressions, t-tests). Nice to have: Experience analyzing survey data.
Since you’ll be taking care of our internal stakeholders, we’re looking for someone who truly enjoys interacting with people on a daily basis. The ability to search for information and ask relevant questions from various teams will be crucial.


Next Steps

Why you'll love working with us

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!


Complex environment with tons of data just waiting to be utilized — you’ll get hands-on experience in working on various TA metrics and topics.
You can choose the ways of working - work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the locations mentioned above.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, think big but stay humble, do right by people, treat others kindly and justly, and recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:

Orsi Kocsis, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - orsolya.kocsis@wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants, and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants), and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 31 countries today, 27 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

So, why work at Wolt?

At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.

You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself, and being around friendly, humble, and ambitious people.

We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.
Show more

  • Demonstrated experience working with and influencing technical and nontechnical cross-functional peers and stakeholders. This will be a highly visible role within the People Team, and building trust with your colleagues will be critical.
  • Tech skills: Python, SQL, R, AWS, and one of the modern BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Sigma, or similar). Advanced SQL skills, and ability to write optimized queries for large data sets.
  • Subject Matter Expertise: Deep expertise in data visualization and analysis. Some expertise in statistics is preferred (regressions, t-tests). Nice to have: Experience analyzing survey data.
  • Since you’ll be taking care of our internal stakeholders, we’re looking for someone who truly enjoys interacting with people on a daily basis. The ability to search for information and ask relevant questions from various teams will be crucial.

Next Steps

Why you'll love working with us

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

  • Complex environment with tons of data just waiting to be utilized — you’ll get hands-on experience in working on various TA metrics and topics.
  • You can choose the ways of working - work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the locations mentioned above.
  • You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, think big but stay humble, do right by people, treat others kindly and justly, and recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:

Orsi Kocsis, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - orsolya.kocsis@wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants, and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants), and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 31 countries today, 27 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

So, why work at Wolt?

At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.

You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself, and being around friendly, humble, and ambitious people.

We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.

Title: Data Analyst (11 months Parental Leave)
Description:
Company Description

**Please note this is a parental leave for 11 months**

H&M Group is one of the biggest fashion companies in the world. We are a family of brands, driven by our mission to make a sustainable lifestyle an option for the many. With our customers at heart, we offer fashion, design, and services to millions of customers every day. 

We believe that it’s when you mix and match different talents, experiences, and styles that the real magic happens. That’s why our teams are built with different personalities, talents and people from all kinds of backgrounds. If you are willing to learn, grow and help our customers and your colleagues, H&M will always be a place for you to both express your individuality and feel like you belong. 

Be yourself & more at H&M. 

Job Description

As a  Data Analyst in the value stream External Products and Partners, you will work closely with Project leaders, Controllers, Business Units and Product teams to create value from data while working towards the goal of improving data foundation and make it possible to evaluate and track the External Brand Business performance and future potentials for the H&M group. 

You will make sure to enable the right attributes and KPIs in the system to secure and develop analysis for external brands as well as finding the potential in data together with other stakeholders for further developments. 

You will work with multiple complex data sources, prepare data, aggregate, and transform both structured & unstructured data. You will create analysis, build reporting tools and dashboards, and products around data, while securing the realization of business value from data. 

This is a highly technical, analytical, and business oriented role that secures analysis and reporting for External Brands. Your focus will be transforming and visualizing large amount of data for many users in a complex data environment. You will be cooperating with large amounts of stakeholders coming from different backgrounds both internally and externally, why we need you to be able to project lead and take own initiatives. 

You will work in a dynamic and diverse team where you will be the main responsible for data and reports for the External Brand business. In this role you will be able to drive change, have the possibility to influence and develop and structure the data possibilities for the external brand business. To succeed you will also need to be able to communicate clearly with many different stakeholders, be curious to solve technical problems and strive to truly understand our business. 

Tasks includes but are not limited to:


Define needs of and set-up measurable KPI’s on different levels of granularity and maintain their visualization by creating and maintaining intuitive dashboards  
Data prep: get the data from multiple complex data sources (APIs, databases, etc.) , clean and transform the data, develop data flows  
Be responsible for data availability and data quality of the value stream (ex: identifying missing data, troubleshooting with responsible data team, ...)
Combine, explore, and draw valuable insights from data. Work with large and complex data assets from different parts of the business  
Identify and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets to enable the business to take data-driven decisions  
Be responsible for external brand data integration with the existing business and business way of working 



Qualifications


3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst or similar relevant experience 
Academic degree within Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or similar  
Ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various stakeholders  
Ability to advise the business in the best solution from both a business and technical perspective  
Experience working within ecommerce, preferably in a multi-channel retail setting 
Ability to work with large and complex data sets. SQL skills is required (SSMS and BigQuery are preferred)
Experience in data visualization (Power BI) 
Experience in data modelling and DAX 
Experience using numerical, statistical, and analytical methods to apply to  data processing  
Ability to translate business requirements into analytical requirements  
Ability to align assignments with the strategic goals of the business    
Ability to establish priorities with clear goals and responsibilities to achieve a high level of performance 



Additional Information

H&M Group is a value-driven company that is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits and a flexible work life, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want.

The role is based in Stockholm. If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV in English. We will review and interview applicants continuously.

Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.

We look forward to receiving your application!

H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.
Show more

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Whitehall resources are looking for a Data Modeller. This role is based onsite in Sweden 2 days per week and remote working the remainder, for an initial 6 month contract.




Job Description:

Working experience in general data modelling like conceptual model, logical dimensional modelling

Adapt modelling methods from case studies or other proven approaches

Experience with data modelling for Redshift and Amazon

Experience of working in AWS cloud environment, Dbt

Experience in Implementation of physical models in databases

Knowledge of ingesting data into Amazon Redshift from on-prem data lake

Knowledge in AWS Data Pipeline, AWS Glue, AWS SCT etc

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineering that makes a difference

At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. Now we are looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.

What You'll Do

You will be a part of the Commercial Data Hub and drive the Commercial data transformation journey towards a data culture where each product team expose their own data in an easily consumable way. To achieve this, we work in a multi-functional setting and your main responsibilities would include:


Building functionality that makes it easier for data consumers within Commercial to consume data in Snowflake
Building and maintaining source and business aligned data products
Giving professional data engineering support to data consumers and help them using the data according to best practices


What You'll Bring

The ideal candidate will possess not only extensive experience with the data engineering technologies we use, but also a high level of proficiency in soft skills.

Your main technical responsibilities includes implementing tooling, developing data pipelines and data governance solutions. Snowflake is used to expose data for analytical purposes and the role requires a solid understanding of Snowflake, including access handling and data protection. Our tech stack is based on Azure, SQL, Python, Snowflake, Airflow and DBT and previous experience working with those technologies will be valuable in the role.

On the soft skills side, you should be a collaborative team player who is adaptable and open to changes. A keen interest in learning and delivering is essential, along with a receptiveness to different perspectives. The role involves significant interaction with stakeholders. You will support analysts and business functions to consume data in an effective way. Understanding their needs and how we can assist them is crucial. Collaboration with the central data platform team is also key, where you will suggest features that aid our team, product teams and data consumers.

The role is a full time position based in Stockholm. You are at this point in time expected to work from the office in average three days per week.

Sounds interesting?

We’d love to receive and review your application. If you want more information about the role and its responsibilities or simply learn a bit more about the team, please reach out to the hiring manager at milika.jovanovic@volvocars.com

Volvo Cars - Driving change together

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations so you can reach your full potential.

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, 50% of which will be electric vehicles and sold directly to customers through digital channels. Join us on the journey of a lifetime as we create the driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Map Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!







Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Swedish.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Sweden.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Sweden for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Description:

2) Work on anonymization of data to enable access to various groups depending on access levels

1)Strong planning and analytical skills.

3)Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Data Privacy , compliance or data governance implementation, Data protection & data security measures(Data encryption) with good knowledge on data security clearance.

Certification or End-to-End implementation of frameworks / offerings experience in any of the Regulations/Act/Laws like CCPA, GDPR, AML, KYC, CDD, MiFID, BCBS, HIPPA, IFRS etc.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
About Us And The Job

At BOLIA, things are always in motion, and we have high ambitions for our IT solutions to create the absolute best experiences for our customers, colleagues, and partners. We are heavily data-driven in our decision-making, and we have a growing need for outstanding BI reports and analyses across the entire business. This includes anything from store personnel to back-office functions, and towards BOLIA's management group.

In short, we have a wealth of data at BOLIA, and we want to make even more and better use of it than we do today! To strengthen this effort, we are looking for a new colleague to act as an internal BI consultant with a primary focus on the PowerBI platform. In this role, you will have a broad interface across all departments at BOLIA, and you will also collaborate with our many external partners in developing new reporting solutions.

Your Responsibilities

The tasks in the job can be numerous and varied, but examples of tasks include:


Drive and participate in the development of reporting solutions in both PowerBI and Excel to enhance BOLIA's ability to make the right decisions.
Ownership of BOLIA’s BI platform, primarily focused on the back-end. However, you will also be expected to assist colleagues with front-end tasks as needed.
Play a crucial role in the ongoing project of taking our current on-prem BI platform to the next level using Microsoft Fabri (you will work closely with external partners).
Data processing and refinement on SQL Server, to enhance data quality and analysis capabilities.
Provide second-level support for BI backend-related tasks.
Vendor management and follow-up on deliveries from external partners.
Participate in various business projects in collaboration with all departments at BOLIA, especially your colleagues in the Business Development team, which primarily handles the front-end work.
Participate in a new BI Center of Excellence in BOLIA to align on the BI efforts.
Stay up to date with new possibilities and trends within your area, such as AI and Microsoft CoPilot for PowerBI.


BOLIA and our IT solutions are undergoing rapid development, providing you with the opportunity to make a significant impact from day one by setting the agenda within the BI area. You will be taking over from the current BI Consultant, who is moving on to new opportunities, and you will become a key figure at our headquarters, collaborating closely with many of your colleagues. Additionally, we will continue to engage external partners to assist with backend BI tasks, who will also serve as your professional sparring partners.

Your Skills

We value personality and practical experience far more than educational background, which can vary. The more of the following points you can check off, the better.


You have a desire to inspire and demonstrate the possibilities of using data and Business Intelligence to make better decisions.
You are a master of PowerBI and data modeling, which is your home court, and have experience in other parts of Microsoft's BI suite.
You have experience with SQL, SSIS and ETL-processes in general.
You have experience with data sources like Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O and/or CE or similar.
You are self-driven but still a team player and eager to acquire new knowledge.
You have a great business understanding and can maintain an overview while also having an eye for detail.
You always deliver high quality in what you do.


Good to Know


We are in the heart of Aarhus, close to the train station, in what are arguably the most beautiful office spaces in Denmark!
There is a very active staff association that regularly organizes all sorts of events from parties to knitting clubs.
We have a young working environment with an amazing unity across all departments.
We are part of the Lars Larsen Group, which means that as an employee, you will receive a good staff discount in all Lars Larsen Group companies, including furniture, restaurants, and spa stays.
Our workday is flexible with possibilities for sometimes working from home.


How To Apply

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so we recommend that you send your application and CV as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Head of IT Applications, Kasper Poulsen, on kpo@bolia.com.

All inquiries will be treated confidentially.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

  • You are self-driven but still a team player and eager to acquire new knowledge.
  • You have a great business understanding and can maintain an overview while also having an eye for detail.
  • You always deliver high quality in what you do.

Good to Know

  • We are in the heart of Aarhus, close to the train station, in what are arguably the most beautiful office spaces in Denmark!
  • There is a very active staff association that regularly organizes all sorts of events from parties to knitting clubs.
  • We have a young working environment with an amazing unity across all departments.
  • We are part of the Lars Larsen Group, which means that as an employee, you will receive a good staff discount in all Lars Larsen Group companies, including furniture, restaurants, and spa stays.
  • Our workday is flexible with possibilities for sometimes working from home.

How To Apply

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so we recommend that you send your application and CV as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Head of IT Applications, Kasper Poulsen, on kpo@bolia.com.

All inquiries will be treated confidentially.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analytics Engineer - Renewables
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are thrilled to present an outstanding opportunity in Copenhagen, working with an energetic, danish born startup that supplies cutting edge analytics for wind turbine and solar operations!




The role will contribute to the development of edge based software for optimisation and maintenance of renewable energy assets, requiring a strong combination of engineering expertise, problem solving skills, and a deep understanding of data analytics.




Responsibilities:




Create predictive maintenance models to identify potential issues and optimise maintenance schedules.
Collaborate with engineers and clients to understand asset operations and identify opportunities for data-driven improvements.
Leverage Python to develop and deploy analytics solutions on edge computing platforms.
Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights aimed at performance optimsation and the identification of underperformance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in renewable energy technology and data analytics.




Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics or a related field.
Proven experience in data analytics (Ideally for renewable energy applications or similar). This can be based on physics models, engineering knowhow or statistical methods.
Strong programming skills in Python, including libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and visualisation tools.
Familiarity with edge computing platforms and technologies.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




Bonus points:




Hands-on experience with renewable energy technologies (e.g, solar PV, wind turbines). This could be in the form of maintenance work or development of these types of assets.
Familiarity with cloud computing and data streaming technologies.
Experience with data structures for high frequency data analysis on big datasets.




Competitive salary + annual bonus scheme.




If you have the necessary skills then please apply today!




Please note: You will need to be eligible to work in Denmark.

Visor Sponsorship is NOT provided.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Senior Data Engineer - Commodities Trading

Location: Copenhagen (hybrid)




The Opportunity

Join a leading international fintech who are looking at hiring a Senior Data Engineer to work closely with their data team.




Who We Are

They leverage cutting-edge technology and deep market expertise to deliver exceptional value to their clients. In this dynamic role, you'll play a key part in our continued growth and success by designing, developing, and implementing data integration solutions.




What You'll Do

Architect and implement seamless data pipelines connecting complex trading systems, legacy infrastructure, and our modern cloud environment (AWS).
Champion the migration of data infrastructure from on-premises to AWS, ensuring efficient and scalable data management.
Partner with the trading team to understand their data needs and build solutions that optimise their workflows.
Foster a collaborative environment by working closely with engineers, data scientists, and the cloud team to guarantee smooth integration across all technical functions.
Lead, mentor, and provide guidance to a team of data engineers and data scientists.
Develop and maintain data mapping strategies using Object Relational Mapping (ORM) systems.
Utilise your strong Python and Java skills to build and manage data pipelines and transformation processes.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of commodities data (experience in finance is a plus).
Maintain a laser focus on system security and ensure all data flows are reliable.




You're a Perfect Fit If You Have

A minimum of 5+ years of experience in data engineering.
Proven experience migrating data infrastructure to the cloud (AWS preferred).
In-depth knowledge of data warehousing, data modelling, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
A solid understanding of complex trading systems and financial data.
Expertise in Object Relational Mapping (ORM) systems.
Excellent Python programming skills.
A proven ability to manage and mentor a team of engineers and data scientists.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Position : Data Modeling Analyst

Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Job Type: Permanent




Detailed description of work task to be carried out




Description:




We are looking for a skilled Data Lead to oversee and guide a team of Data and Business Analysts responsible for securing the data requirements enabling the introduction of a new generation Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) Investigation tool.

In your role you will be collaborating closely with the Data Team Product Owner to drive change in accordance with the FCP Data strategy, ensuring Data Governance, Data Quality and Data Products are delivered in accordance with the business need.

Furthermore, you will be working with a range of diverse stakeholders including Business, Architecture, and Technology owners to align on business requirements, whilst driving efficient project execution in accordance with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).




Key Responsibilities:




Be servant leader and enabler for a team of data and business analysts ensuring the performance and quality of deliverables.

Collaborate closely with stakeholders from Business, Architecture, Train trio and Technology to facilitate decisions and drive the delivery of data requirements according to set data strategy.




Description of knowledge and experience




Qualifications:




Senior Business Analyst (5-8 years)

Proven experience in leading data teams

Excellent stakeholder management skills

Excellent communication skills

Excellent facilitation skills

Very good understanding of data strategy and data modelling principles

Very good understanding of IT strategy and Architecture

Good understanding of principals around data modelling from business and performance perspective

Very good change management understanding

Good understanding of Financial Services and Financial Crime

Fluent English (spoken and written)




Detailed description of work task to be carried out




Work as business analyst in a team working on AnaCredit implementation in Snowflake. Responsibilities includes analysis on the needed changes, data quality impact using new sourcing, prototyping of the changes, sharing the requirements




Tasks:




data analysis, capturing data dependencies and results impact

understanding of the reporting process

cross team cooperation

setting up requirements

documentation

testing
